section.title: Locales
section.para: The locale resource let's you internationnalize your application into multiple languages. By default, Majisti assumes that the application is using the en locale, but that can be changed through configuration. More locales can also be added as a list of available locales to the application. Here's how to configure I18n:resources.locales.available = en resources.locales.available = fr resources.locales.available = es
This will enable three languages for your application: English, French and Spanish, English being the default one since it is the first one. You can change its default:resources.locales.default = fr

Since the I18n controller plugin is enabled by default, this will automatically enable language switching for your application through url parameters. You can then combine this with view script blocks such as the language-switcher.
